meanings.definition: A very small amount or quantity.
meanings.sent1: She only needed a few smidges of sugar for her tea.
meanings.sent2: He added a couple of smidges of salt to the soup.
meanings.sent3: The chef sprinkled smidges of love into every dish she made.
meanings.sent4: The stars twinkled like smidges of light in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully added smidges of color to the painting, creating a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To add a small amount or quantity.
meanings.sent1: Please smidges the spices into the sauce for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: She always smidges a bit of honey into her morning oatmeal.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf smidges glitter on everything in the house.
meanings.sent4: The singer smidges emotion into every note she sings.
meanings.sent5: The gardener gently smidges water onto the delicate flowers to keep them hydrated.
